tweet_text:
It is the only way out of these uncertain times because no one is safe until everyone is safe.

Thank you. @hans_kluge
text_en: It is the only way out of these uncertain times because no one is safe until everyone is safe.Thank you.

tweet_text: Be it vaccine allocation and prioritization, access to medical supplies & tests, public health measures & policies to control the pandemic, we have a responsibility to base decisions on the core values that are at the heart of humanity: solidarity, equity and social justice.
text_en: Be it vaccine allocation and prioritization, access to medical supplies & tests, public health measures & policies to control the pandemic, we have a responsibility to base decisions on the core values that are at the heart of humanity: solidarity, equity and social justice.

tweet_text: I wish also to emphasize that this decision has been taken in accordance with already available evidence on vaccine efficacy from clinical trials. Dr Siddhartha Datta who is with us, may elaborate on this when we take questions. @hans_kluge
text_en: I wish also to emphasize that this decision has been taken in accordance with already available evidence on vaccine efficacy from clinical trials. Dr Siddhartha Datta who is with us, may elaborate on this when we take questions.

tweet_text: It is important that such a decision represents a safe compromise between the limited global production capacity at the moment, & the imperative for governments to protect as many people as possible while reducing the burden of any subsequent 'wave' on the health systems.
text_en: It is important that such a decision represents a safe compromise between the limited global production capacity at the moment, & the imperative for governments to protect as many people as possible while reducing the burden of any subsequent 'wave' on the health systems.

tweet_text: We have all taken note of the recommendation to make the time between the first and second dose of the vaccine more flexible than what was initially prescribed by the manufacturer. @hans_kluge
text_en: We have all taken note of the recommendation to make the time between the first and second dose of the vaccine more flexible than what was initially prescribed by the manufacturer.

tweet_text: Following the @WHO Emergency Use Listing last week on the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine, the Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization (SAGE) met on Tuesday to discuss policy recommendations around the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine. @hans_kluge
text_en: Following the Emergency Use Listing last week on the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine, the Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization (SAGE) met on Tuesday to discuss policy recommendations around the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine.

tweet_text: Whilst I appreciate that it poses an extraordinary effort, the benefits are phenomenal. @hans_kluge
text_en: Whilst I appreciate that it poses an extraordinary effort, the benefits are phenomenal.

tweet_text: I want to emphasize that vaccine roll-outs are essential, first and foremost, to reduce severe disease in vulnerable groups, release the pressure on our hospitals and avoid the risk of our health systems collapsing. @hans_kluge
text_en: I want to emphasize that vaccine roll-outs are essential, first and foremost, to reduce severe disease in vulnerable groups, release the pressure on our hospitals and avoid the risk of our health systems collapsing.

tweet_text: At this point in time, and after so many months in cycles of hope and despair, herd immunity is an understandable desired end-point. Yet it cannot be our immediate, primary concern. @hans_kluge
text_en: At this point in time, and after so many months in cycles of hope and despair, herd immunity is an understandable desired end-point. Yet it cannot be our immediate, primary concern.

tweet_text: Their courage and sacrifice over the last few months cannot be forgotten, it is time to protect and support the frontline workers with the new tools we have. @hans_kluge
text_en: Their courage and sacrifice over the last few months cannot be forgotten, it is time to protect and support the frontline workers with the new tools we have.

tweet_text: Given the limited supply of vaccines and the increasing burden on our health systems, prioritisation of vaccination of our health workforce and the most at-risk in our communities is vital. @hans_kluge
text_en: Given the limited supply of vaccines and the increasing burden on our health systems, prioritisation of vaccination of our health workforce and the most at-risk in our communities is vital.

tweet_text: Collectively, we simply cannot afford to leave any country, any community behind. @hans_kluge
text_en: Collectively, we simply cannot afford to leave any country, any community behind.

tweet_text: However, whilst I can reassure you that @WHO and partners are making huge efforts to get the vaccines into every country, it needs every country capable of contributing, donating and supporting equitable access and deployment of the vaccines, to do so. @hans_kluge
text_en: However, whilst I can reassure you that and partners are making huge efforts to get the vaccines into every country, it needs every country capable of contributing, donating and supporting equitable access and deployment of the vaccines, to do so.

tweet_text: The deployment of #COVID19 vaccine in few countries in the WHO European Region has set the ground of using “vaccine” as one of the tools to contain the ongoing pandemic. There have been reports of varied but promising roll-out of #COVID19 vaccine in the region. @hans_kluge
text_en: The deployment of vaccine in few countries in the WHO European Region has set the ground of using vaccine as one of the tools to contain the ongoing pandemic. There have been reports of varied but promising roll-out of vaccine in the region.

tweet_text: Adhering to generalised mask wearing, limiting social gathering numbers, physical distancing & hand washing, coupled with adequate testing & tracing systems, proper support for quarantine & isolation, & increasingly vaccination, will work if we all get involved. @hans_kluge
text_en: Adhering to generalised mask wearing, limiting social gathering numbers, physical distancing & hand washing, coupled with adequate testing & tracing systems, proper support for quarantine & isolation, & increasingly vaccination, will work if we all get involved.

tweet_text: It’s the basic measures, with which we are all familiar, that need to be intensified to bring down transmission, lift the strain on our #COVID19 wards, and save lives. @hans_kluge
text_en: Its the basic measures, with which we are all familiar, that need to be intensified to bring down transmission, lift the strain on our wards, and save lives.

tweet_text: This is an alarming situation, which means that for a short period of time need to do more than we have done and to intensify the public health and social measures to be certain we can flatten the steep vertical line in some countries which may not have seen to date. @hans_kluge
text_en: This is an alarming situation, which means that for a short period of time need to do more than we have done and to intensify the public health and social measures to be certain we can flatten the steep vertical line in some countries which may not have seen to date.

text_en: sharing this data, so that we can better understand the true extent in circulation of this and other variants. Solidarity in science is crucial at this time.

tweet_text:
I want to urge countries to mitigate this burden by doing all they can to reduce transmission and increase vigilance to identify any new variants by:

1⃣investigating unusually rapid transmission and unexpected disease presentation or severity
text_en: I want to urge countries to mitigate this burden by doing all they can to reduce transmission and increase vigilance to identify any new variants by:1investigating unusually rapid transmission and unexpected disease presentation or severity

tweet_text: With increased transmissibility and similar disease severity, the variant does, however, raise alarm: without increased control to slow its spread, there will be an increased impact on already stressed and pressurized health facilities. @hans_kluge
text_en: With increased transmissibility and similar disease severity, the variant does, however, raise alarm: without increased control to slow its spread, there will be an increased impact on already stressed and pressurized health facilities.

tweet_text: It spreads across all age groups, and children do not appear to be at higher-risk. It is our assessment that this variant of concern may, over time, replace other circulating lineages as seen in the United Kingdom, and increasingly in Denmark. @hans_kluge
text_en: It spreads across all age groups, and children do not appear to be at higher-risk. It is our assessment that this variant of concern may, over time, replace other circulating lineages as seen in the United Kingdom, and increasingly in Denmark.

tweet_text: This variant is ‘of concern’ as it has increased transmissibility. So far, we understand there is no significant change to the disease this variant produces, meaning the #COVID19 is not more, nor less, severe. @hans_kluge
text_en: This variant is of concern as it has increased transmissibility. So far, we understand there is no significant change to the disease this variant produces, meaning the is not more, nor less, severe.

tweet_text: Like all viruses, as it has circulated, the #COVID19 virus has changed over time. I do understand the concern around the possible impact of the SARS CoV-2 Variant of Concern (VOC). 22 countries in the WHO European region have detected this new variant. @hans_kluge
text_en: Like all viruses, as it has circulated, the virus has changed over time. I do understand the concern around the possible impact of the SARS CoV-2 Variant of Concern (VOC). countries in the WHO European region have detected this new variant.

tweet_text: 2021 brings with it new opportunities and tools, such as the vaccine, but also new challenges posed by the virus itself. @hans_kluge
text_en: brings with it new opportunities and tools, such as the vaccine, but also new challenges posed by the virus itself.

tweet_text: Assessing developments over the current days before gradual lifting of any measures in place is the prudent approach required. @hans_kluge
text_en: Assessing developments over the current days before gradual lifting of any measures in place is the prudent approach required.

tweet_text: Testing and notification activities may have also been lower during the festive season, resulting in an incomplete picture of the current epidemiological situation. @hans_kluge
text_en: Testing and notification activities may have also been lower during the festive season, resulting in an incomplete picture of the current epidemiological situation.

tweet_text: The impact of the holiday period, of gatherings of families, communities, and any relaxation of physical distancing and mask wearing behaviour for example, cannot yet be determined. @hans_kluge
text_en: The impact of the holiday period, of gatherings of families, communities, and any relaxation of physical distancing and mask wearing behaviour for example, cannot yet be determined.

On a quest for a #COVID19 test? 🦠🧪💉🔬

Before seeking a test, it’s important to know exactly which type of test you need. 

👉 RT-PCR and antigen tests tell you if you have the virus NOW.

Overall, cardiovascular diseases remain the main contributor to #NCDs for both men & women. Although premature death from #CVD has been declining for decades, in some countries these figures have stagnated or even started increasing recently.

(4/5) https://t.co/hcCkzBNk8X
text_en: Overall, cardiovascular diseases remain the main contributor to for both men & women. Although premature death from has been declining for decades, in some countries these figures have stagnated or even started increasing recently.(4/5)

tweet_text:
The report also finds that a higher percentage of women in the older age groups have biological risk factors such as being overweight or obese, raised blood pressure, glucose & cholesterol. In younger age groups men have higher levels of these risk factors.

(3/5)
text_en: The report also finds that a higher percentage of women in the older age groups have biological risk factors such as being overweight or obese, raised blood pressure, glucose & cholesterol. In younger age groups men have higher levels of these risk factors.(3/5)

tweet_text:
According to the report, higher percentages of men than women in most age groups engage in behavioural risk factors. This includes tobacco smoking, alcohol consumption, insufficient intake of fruits & vegetables, & the frequent consumption of processed foods.

(2/5) https://t.co/JuzS8P1kQ7
